Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.

About This Role

The SIOP Demand Planning Manager will have oversight of the regional Consensus Demand Plan for the Commercial HVAC business. This role will oversee the regional demand planning process and provide strategic direction to continuously enhance demand planning capabilities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Commercial Leaders to develop an 18-month consensus demand plan for assigned Business Unit through the monthly SIOP cycle.
  • Partner with stakeholders across teams to capture all inputs to the demand plan and to ensure adjustments and improvements to forecasting models and methodologies are implemented.
  • Integrate firm backlog, order pipeline, bookings forecast, statistical forecasting, portfolio management, NPI, market intelligence and other product demand signals to create a consensus demand forecast.
  • Coordinates cross-functional discussions to document and challenge Demand Plan assumptions and refine the forecast.
  • Analyze performance and metrics to identify causes of forecast error and bias and develop and implement plans to correct errors
  • Stay updated on market trends, industry dynamics, and customer behavior
  • Develop plan to capture opportunities and identified demand changes
  • Collaborate with senior management to align demand planning initiatives with overall business strategies and goals. Ensure alignment between revenue and demand plans.
  • Understand the drivers of demand changes, customers, and revenue impacts and potential effects on the downstream processes.
  • Lead continuous improvement efforts to advance the demand planning and forecasting process capabilities

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 6+ years of experience in Supply Chain functions of SIOP, Forecasting, Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Inventory Planning, Materials Management, Master Planning, or Scheduling

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong Working knowledge of S&OE and S&OP with implementation experience
  • MBA or master’s degree
  • Ability to build cross-functional relationships through strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with demand planning tools
  • Advanced capability in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
